original: PETERSSON, Sven Olof Gunnar, Bergsingenjör, Stockholm, f Ekeby, Ögl, 3/10 99 av lantbr C A Th P o Frida Carlsson, gm Rut Nordström. Studex Link 19, KTH (bergs) 20—25, ex 20. Anst AB Bl Malmletn o utf mätn.arb i Sydafr, N o S Rhodesia 26—28, inköpare av diamanter o ch f J D Brusell & Cia, Bahia, Brasilien, f försäljn.avd f sv prod samt Stat exportstip f N Brasilien 28—29, af f.ing Sv Diamantbergborrn.AB sed. 29, styr.-suppl där. Styr.led Craelius East African Drilling Co Ltd Nairobi; Lange, Lorche & Co G m b H Dresden : sekr. Sv Tekn.frns avd f kemi o bergsvet; led IMM, London. Resor: Engl, Frankr, Algeriet, Marocko, Span, Tyskl, Balkan, Egypt, Sudan, Uganda, Kenya, Tan-ganjika, Rhodesia, Sydafr, Brasil 26—39. Av trycket: »Djupborrning» i De Tekn Vetensk (31), »Sandstens- o kalkstensomr s grundvattentäkter» Tekn tidskr (40), div art Tekn tidskr mfl tidskr.
translated: PETERSSON, Sven Olof Gunnar, Mining engineer, Stockholm, born in Ekeby, Ögl, on October 3rd, 1899, to farmer C A Th P and Frida Carlsson. Married to Rut Nordström. Graduated from Linköping High School in 1919, and from the Royal Institute of Technology (mining) in 1920-1925, with an additional examination in 1920. Employed by AB Bl Malmletn and performed surveying work in South Africa and North and South Rhodesia from 1926 to 1928. Became a diamond buyer and chief representative for J D Brusell & Cia in Bahia, Brazil. Also worked in the sales department of Swedish products and received a state export scholarship for North Brazil from 1928-1929. Became a board member of the Swedish Diamond Mining Company AB in 1929 and later served as a supervisory director there. Held positions on the board of Craelius East African Drilling Co Ltd in Nairobi, Lange, Lorche & Co GmbH in Dresden, and served as secretary for the Swedish Technical Society's department of chemistry and mining. Was a member of the Institution of Mining and Metallurgy in London. Traveled extensively to England, France, Algeria, Morocco, Spain, Germany, the Balkans, Egypt, Sudan, Uganda, Kenya, Tanganyika, Rhodesia, South Africa, and Brazil from 1926 to 1939. Published articles such as "Deep Drilling" in De Tekniska Vetenskaperna (1931) and "Groundwater Sources in Sandstone and Limestone Areas" in Teknisk Tidskrift (1940), as well as various other articles in scientific journals.
